entries.description: Helm 2 is not supported anymore, please use Helm 3 instead. It might still be possible to install KKP using Helm 2, but it's neither supported nor recommended.
The new backup mechanism replaces the old mechanism and is not backwards compatible. Furthermore the admin of the platform needs to enable the backup mechanism as described in the documentation.
User cluster monitoring, logging and alerting
Cluster templates for deploying optimal clusters instantly
Metering tool integration for easier accountability of resources (EE only)
AWS spot instances support to optimize workloads
User cluster backup & restore UI
Enhancements on Open Policy Agent for allowed container registries and standard policies
Kubevirt cloud controller integration
Add Kubernetes 1.22 support
Enabled CCM and CSI migration on distinct cloud providers
Docker to containerd container runtime migration
Removed Gatekeeper from default accessible addon list
Do not delete custom links after pressing enter key
Fix a bug that always applies default values to container resources
Fix cluster list endpoint that was returning errors when user didn't have access to at least one cluster datacenter
Fix finalizers duplication
Fix issue where Kubermatic non-admin users were not allowed to manage Kubermatic Constraints
Fix issue where cluster validation was failing on certificate error because the validation provider was not using the provided custom CA Bundle
Fix missed cluster-autoscaler resource from the ClusterRole
Fix user-ssh-keys-agent migration
Fix for Seed API PATCH endpoint which sometimes removed Seed fields unrelated to the PATCH

Fix the issue where Seed API was using seed clients to update the Seeds on master cluster instead of using the master client. This was causing Seed API not to work on Seeds which were not also the master clusters.
